name: places/ChIJ7S1lLCJZwokRxB5ZKWzGmqg
formattedAddress: 180 Ludlow St, New York, NY 10002, USA
adrFormatAddress: 180 Ludlow St, New York, NY 10002, USA

editorialSummary.text: Warm quarters in a trendy hotel offering a French restaurant, a fashionable bar & a sunroom.

originalText.text: You get what you pay for - and this is my new favorite hotel in the Lower East Side. Everything from service, to the rooms (views, comfy beds, city views from the terrace) to the lounge bar exceeded my expectations. The attention to detail is high, and I loved the eclectic, artsy decor. I felt lie I was stay in my friends chic apartment rather than a hotel. I will be returning on future visits to the city - THANK YOU to The Ludlow staff for an exceptional stay.

originalText.text:
Out of all the beautiful places to stay in Manhattan this has been and continues to remain my favorite place to stay in all of Manhattan.

Whether you’re looking for ambience, comfort, services, dining, location, or quality this place blows any other place out of the water.

From the moment you walk into the cozy yet posh lobby, you are greeted by the most sincere and helpful staff. As you check in you’re surrounded by one of the most popular, bustling restaurant and lounges, Dirty French, that always keeps the place feeling alive and welcoming. Once you get to your room, you realize this is not just a hotel it’s a cozy sanctuary. The attention to detail and guest services are top of the line. Laundry and dry cleaning on site with even the option for overnight cleaning in case you’re in a pinch.

Walking distance to a plethora of various shopping opportunities specifically Soho being only blocks away. The views are immaculate out of any window you look out of and the staff is so helpful regardless of what you may need. If you’re looking for a GREAT hotel stay at the Ludlow.

originalText.text:
My husband and I spent last Christmas at the Ludlow and it was a very nice experience.
What I liked:
- The lounge was amazing and well decorated with a nice fireplace.
-We liked the possibility to order drinks and food directly at the lounge
-The people working at the front desk were very nice and professional
-The hotel and the room were very clean and beautiful.

What I would improve:
-We stayed for more than 3 days so the bedrooms (queen studio) was too small and we were missing space to open our luggage. I wouldn't have minded for a 2 days trip though.
-I would suggest you tell your clients if the possibility to eat the the lounge is unavailable for whatever reason (we didn't know during Christmas day and had to find a place to eat at 8pm - not a real issue in NYC though)
-I had the feeling clients of the restaurant had access to the lounge as well and I found it a bit odd as it is already small and it is a great amenty for the clients of the hotel.
-The food at the Dirty French was not great. We ate there just once and were disappointed.

Despite some room for improvement, it was a great experience: the hotel is clean and beautiful, the service was amazing and the staff was so nice. I would go back with no hesitation!

originalText.text: The Ludlow boasts a European flare with eclectic interior design motifs (picture Paris' Left Bank meets The Lower East side meets The Wild West). The staff is professional, welcoming and friendly, and the service is impeccable. Whether enjoying brunch or a three-course dinner, the cuisine is consistently clean and lean. Finally, The human-scale of the foyer, dining room, bar and  lounge areas welcome the sunlight by day, and feature a warm, candlelight effect by night. We could not be more pleased with our experience.

We could not be more pleased with our experience.

originalText.text: My wife and daughter stayed there for our Christmas holiday. Everyone was so personal and great. Loved the vibe and the location was spot on. Can't say enough good, from house keeping and more. They even had a Christmas buffet in the bar inclusive to all hotel guests. It was such a nice gesture and I do believed everyone loved it!! The rooms, depending, are small but have everything you need. My family travels from Georgia and usually we stay in the Columbia Circle area The LudLow is now our go to hotel. The lower east side is where it's at. Can't wait until our next visit.
